item.title: 美国与加拿大将于未来数周就贸易问题举行会谈，格里尔表示
item.description: 美国贸易代表杰米森·格里尔周三表示，美加贸易官员已进行磋商，并计划在未来几周内举行会晤。他补充称，特朗普政府对双方就达成协议提出的建议持开放态度。【原文：U.S. and Canadian trade officials spoke on Wednesday and plan to meet in coming weeks, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said, adding that the Trump administration was open to their ideas on how to reach an agreement.】

item.title: 以色列人工智能网络安全公司Gambit Security完成6100万美元融资
item.description: 总部位于特拉维夫的网络安全公司Gambit Security周三宣布，在结束长达一年的"隐身模式"后，已完成6100万美元的早期融资。【原文：Tel Aviv-based cybersecurity firm Gambit Security said on Wednesday it had raised $61 million in an early funding round as it emerged from more than a year in "stealth mode".】

item.title: 意大利电信考虑在大型活动中对高性能网络连接实施溢价定价
item.description: 意大利电信公司首席执行官周三表示，该公司正考虑推出高价点播移动服务，以满足客户在大型体育赛事等大型聚会期间对快速稳定网络连接的需求。【原文：Telecom Italia is exploring the introduction of premium-priced on-demand mobile services for customers seeking guaranteed fast and stable connectivity during large gatherings such as major sports events, its boss said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 纳斯达克上调核心业务部门中期营收目标，得益于资本接入平台业务的强劲增长
item.description: 纳斯达克周三上调了其最大业务部门的中期营收预期，主要基于数据、上市和指数业务的强劲表现。【原文：Nasdaq raised the medium-term revenue forecast for its biggest division on Wednesday, banking on strength in its data, listing and index businesses.】

item.title: 西班牙反垄断监管机构称苹果、亚马逊耗时过长才完善反竞争合同
item.description: 西班牙竞争监管机构周三裁定，苹果和亚马逊耗时过长才从合同中删除反竞争条款——此前监管机构已要求两家公司立即删除这些条款，这些条款规定了亚马逊作为苹果分销商的条件。【原文：Apple and Amazon took too long to remove anti-competitive clauses they were ordered to immediately remove from contracts outlining Amazon's conditions as an Apple distributor, Spain's competition regulator ruled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 泰瑟枪制造商Axon股价上涨，因政府支出提振其利润
item.description: 周三盘前交易中，电击枪制造商Axon Enterprise股价飙升16%，此前该公司公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其安防设备和软件产品需求强劲。【原文：Axon Enterprise shares jumped 16% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the Taser-maker reported fourth‑quarter profit above Wall Street expectations, on strong demand for its security devices and software products.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表办公室称，对部分国家关税税率将升至15%或更高
item.description: 美国贸易代表杰米森·格里尔周三表示，美国对部分国家的关税税率将从新实施的10%上调至15%或更高，但未具体说明涉及哪些贸易伙伴或提供其他细节。【原文：The U.S. tariff rate for some countries will go up to 15% or higher from the newly-imposed 10%, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Wednesday, without naming any specific trading partners or other details.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧佩克+将考虑4月增产13.7万桶/日
item.description: 知情人士透露，欧佩克+可能考虑将4月份的原油日产量提高13.7万桶，以结束为期三个月的增产暂停期。该组织正为夏季用油高峰做准备，而美国与欧佩克成员国伊朗之间的紧张局势推高了油价。【原文：OPEC+ will likely consider raising its oil output by 137,000 barrels per day for April to end a three-month pause in production increases, three sources with knowledge of OPEC+ thinking said, as the group prepares for peak summer demand and tensions between the U.S. and OPEC member Iran boost prices.】

item.title: 诺华将在得克萨斯州建设放射性配体疗法基地以扩大美国生产能力
item.description: 诺华周三宣布计划在得克萨斯州建设放射性配体疗法生产基地，此举将扩大其在美国的市场布局——该基地将成为该公司在得州的首个此类设施，也是全美第五个此类生产基地。【原文：Novartis said on Wednesday it intends to build a radioligand therapy manufacturing site in Texas, expanding its U.S. footprint with what will be its first such facility in the state and fifth nationwide.】

item.title: TJX公司预测全年销售额和利润将保持温和增长，因消费者削减开支
item.description: TJX公司周三公布的年度销售额和利润预期低于华尔街预期，尽管季度业绩超出预期，这表明在宏观经济不确定性背景下，注重预算的消费者在非必需品消费方面趋于谨慎。【原文：TJX Cos forecast annual sales and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday despite a quarterly results beat, signaling strained discretionary spending among budget-conscious consumers amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 德国寻求借助人工智能现代化安全机构以打击有组织犯罪
item.description: 德国财政部、内政部和司法部周三宣布，该国计划对主要安全机构进行现代化改造，并引入人工智能技术打击有组织犯罪，重点打击金融犯罪、洗钱及涉毒案件。【原文：Germany plans to modernise its main security authorities and enlist AI in its fight against organised crime, as it cracks down on financial offences, money laundering and drug-related cases, the ministries of finance, interior affairs and justice said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道称，英美科技协议谨慎重启，聚焦核能项目
item.description: 据《金融时报》周三报道，美国和英国已初步重启价值数十亿英镑的"科技繁荣协议"谈判工作。该协议去年因美国总统特朗普向英国施压要求在更广泛的贸易谈判中让步而暂停。【原文：The U.S. and Britain have tentatively restarted work on their multi-billion-pound "tech prosperity deal", which was paused last year after President Donald Trump piled pressure on the UK to cede ground in wider trade talks, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 政策不确定性加剧，First Solar业绩预测疲软，股价暴跌
item.description: 第一太阳能公司股价周三盘前交易中暴跌16.7%，此前该公司预测年度销售额将低于华尔街预期，原因是特朗普政府时期美国政策环境不确定以及审批延迟。【原文：Shares of First Solar slumped 16.7% in premarket trading on Wednesday, after the company forecast annual sales below Wall Street expectations amid U.S. policy environment uncertainty and permitting delays under the Trump administration.】

item.title: 投资者气候组织以更宽松的规则重新启动，但美国成员减少
item.description: 净零资产管理人倡议周三重启，在经历一年暂停后拥有超过250名成员，且规则有所放宽——此前美国政治反弹导致贝莱德退出该气候组织。【原文：The Net Zero Asset Managers initiative re-launched on Wednesday with more than 250 members after a year-long suspension and with looser rules after a U.S. political backlash prompted BlackRock to leave the climate group.】

item.title: 晨间竞价：又一天，又一次AI情绪波动
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: Deliveroo意大利分部因涉嫌劳工剥削被置于监管之下
item.description: 据路透社周三看到的司法文件显示，米兰检察官已对食品配送平台Deliveroo的意大利分支机构实施司法监督，并对该公司首席执行官展开调查，指控其涉嫌剥削工人。【原文：Milan prosecutors have placed the Italian arm of food delivery platform Deliveroo under judicial supervision and its chief executive under investigation for alleged exploitation of workers, judicial documents seen by Reuters showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: Circle第四季度营收因稳定币流通量强劲增长而上升
item.description: Circle周三报告称第四季度营收增长，其稳定币USDC流通量上升推动储备收益提升，股价在盘前交易中上涨逾14%。【原文：Circle reported an increase in fourth-quarter revenue on Wednesday, as income from reserves got a boost from a rise in circulation of its stablecoin token, USDC, sending its shares up over 14% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 《商报》报道：宝马正与欧盟就"中国制造"迷你车的关税豁免进行谈判
item.description: 据德国《商报》周二报道，宝马公司与欧盟委员会正就一项可能的最低定价模式进行磋商，该模式或将取代欧盟对这家德国汽车制造商在中国生产的迷你电动汽车征收的关税。【原文：BMW and the European Commission are in talks about a possible minimum pricing model that could replace EU tariffs on the German carmaker's Chinese-made Mini electric vehicles, Germany's Handelsblatt business daily reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 劳氏公司预测全年销售额将下滑，因消费者推迟大额家居翻新项目
item.description: 劳氏公司周三公布的年度销售额和利润预测低于华尔街预期，因经济不确定性加剧及借贷成本上升，更多美国人推迟大额家居装修项目并缩减DIY支出。【原文：Lowe's Cos forecast annual sales and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as more Americans delay big-ticket home renovations and rein in do-it-yourself spending amid economic uncertainty and elevated borrowing costs.】

item.title: 女子因社交媒体成瘾起诉Meta和YouTube，现于庭审中出庭作证
item.description: 一名加州女子将于周三出庭作证，讲述童年时期使用Meta平台的Instagram和谷歌的YouTube如何影响了她的心理健康。这场具有里程碑意义的审判正在洛杉矶持续进行。【原文：A California woman is set to testify in court on Wednesday about how using Meta Platforms' Instagram and Google's YouTube as a child affected her mental health, as her landmark trial in Los Angeles continues.】

item.title: OpenAI封禁加拿大校园枪击案凶手账号引发对其其他网络活动的审查
item.description: OpenAI承认在18岁枪手杰西·范·鲁特塞拉尔杀害八人并自杀数月前，就已封禁其ChatGPT账户。这一披露引发了对其过往网络活动的更多关注，并引发质疑：是否错失了阻止加拿大史上最严重大规模枪击案的机会。【原文：OpenAI's admission it banned the ChatGPT account of mass shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar months before the 18-year-old killed eight people and herself is drawing more scrutiny to her past online activity and raising questions about whether opportunities were missed to prevent one of Canada's worst-ever mass killings.】

item.title: 谷歌捣毁了与中国有关联的黑客组织，该组织曾攻击全球53个团体
item.description: 谷歌周三表示，该公司已瓦解一个与中国有关联的黑客组织，该组织曾入侵42个国家至少53家机构。【原文：Google disrupted a Chinese-linked hacking group that breached at least 53 organizations across 42 countries, the company said Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家：美国下令外交官抵制数据主权倡议
item.description: 一份内部外交电报称，此类举措可能干扰人工智能相关服务。【原文：An internal diplomatic cable said such efforts could interfere with AI-related services.】

item.title: 期权交易者对英伟达财报发布后最小幅度的波动进行定价
item.description: 尽管投资者希望这家芯片制造商的财报能为人工智能行业前景提供指引，但股票期权市场的交易员们对英伟达季度业绩可能对股价产生的影响表现得异常谨慎。【原文：Traders in the equity options market are unusually subdued about how much Nvidia's quarterly results might move the stock, even as investors hope the chipmaker's earnings report will shed light on the outlook for the artificial-intelligence trade.】

item.title: 摇摇欲坠的美国科技贸易为市场踩下刹车，英伟达测试临近
item.description: 科技股交易在2026年开局不利，这源于对人工智能颠覆性冲击的担忧以及滞后板块的吸引力，但若没有这个重量级板块的助力，大盘恐难实现显著涨幅。【原文：The technology stock trade has stumbled out of the starting block in 2026, stemming from pressure from artificial intelligence disruption fears and the allure of groups that have lagged, but the broader market may struggle to make substantial gains without the heavyweight sector's help.】

item.title: 中国表示已履行对美贸易义务，警告勿加征关税
item.description: 中国周三表示，已履行与美国《301条款》不公平贸易行为相关的义务。此前美国贸易代表表示将持续开展可能导致加征关税的调查。【原文：China said on Wednesday it had already met obligations linked to Washington's Section 301 unfair trade practices statute, after the U.S. Trade Representative signalled he would continue investigations that could lead to more tariffs.】

item.title: 美国股市期货小幅上涨，英伟达财报前夕人工智能担忧情绪缓解
item.description: 周三美国股指期货小幅走高，在经历本周早些时段的剧烈波动后趋于平稳。投资者正评估人工智能板块面临的风险以及关税疑云加剧的影响，同时等待英伟达稍晚公布的财报。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were slightly higher on Wednesday, stabilizing after volatile sessions earlier this week as investors assessed risks to the AI trade and brewing tariff doubts heading into Nvidia's earnings due later in the day.】

item.title: ASML在2025年年度报告中将人工智能需求视为长期增长动力
item.description: 全球最大的芯片光刻设备供应商ASML在周三发布的2025年年度报告中表示，当前人工智能热潮已成为推动其产品需求的主要动力。【原文：ASML , the biggest supplier of lithography equipment used to make computer chips, said in its 2025 annual report published Wednesday it now sees the artificial intelligence boom as the main driver for demand for its products.】

item.title: 运动品牌On在韩国开设机器人工厂以应对供应链风险
item.description: 运动品牌On Running周三宣布，已在韩国釜山开设工厂，利用机器人生产跑鞋，并计划在美国和欧洲增设更多机器人工厂，以加快生产和交付速度。【原文：Sportswear brand On Running has opened a factory in Busan, South Korea using robots to make running shoes and plans more robot factories in the United States and Europe as it tries to speed up manufacturing and delivery, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: SK海力士将在韩国投资150亿美元建设新半导体工厂
item.description: 韩国SK海力士周三宣布，计划投资21.6万亿韩元（约合150.7亿美元），在2030年前于韩国龙仁市新建芯片生产线，以满足不断增长的半导体需求。【原文：South Korea's SK Hynix said on Wednesday that it plans to invest 21.6 trillion won ($15.07 billion) to build new chip production lines in the South Korean city of Yongin by 2030 to meet rising demand for semiconductors.】
